name: Spaghetti Carbonara
instructions: Cook the spaghetti in salted boiling water until al dente.
In a large pan, cook the pancetta with the garlic until crispy. Remove garlic afterward.
Beat the eggs in a bowl, then add pecorino and parmesan. Mix well.
Drain the pasta and add to the pancetta. Remove from heat.
Quickly add the egg and cheese mixture, stirring vigorously to create a creamy sauce.
Season with salt and black pepper. Serve immediately.

name: Chicken Curry
instructions: Heat oil in a large pot and sauté onions until golden.
Add garlic and ginger, cooking for another minute.
Stir in the curry powder and turmeric, cooking for another minute.
Add chicken pieces and cook until browned on all sides.
Pour in the chopped tomatoes and coconut milk. Stir well.
Simmer for 30-40 minutes until the chicken is cooked through.
Season with salt and pepper. Garnish with cilantro before serving.

name: Vegetable Stir-fry
instructions: Heat oil in a wok or large pan over high heat.
Add garlic and onion, sautéing until fragrant.
Add the rest of the vegetables and stir-fry for 5-7 minutes.
Stir in the soy sauce, oyster sauce, and sesame oil.
Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Serve immediately with rice or noodles.

name: Beef Tacos
instructions: Cook the ground beef in a pan over medium heat until browned.
Add the onion and garlic, cooking until softened.
Stir in the cumin and chili powder. Cook for another minute.
Warm the taco shells according to package instructions.
Fill the taco shells with the beef mixture, lettuce, tomato, and cheese.
Top with sour cream and serve immediately.

name: Pancakes
instructions: In a bowl, mix flour, sugar, baking powder, and salt.
In another bowl, beat the egg and add the milk and melted butter.
Combine the wet and dry ingredients, stirring until just combined.
Heat a non-stick pan and add a small amount of butter or oil.
Pour batter onto the pan and cook until bubbles form on the surface.
Flip and cook until golden brown on both sides.
Serve with your favorite toppings.

name: Caesar Salad
instructions: Chop the romaine lettuce and place in a large bowl.
Add the shaved parmesan and croutons.
Toss with Caesar dressing until evenly coated.
Top with sliced grilled chicken if desired.
Serve immediately.

name: Tomato Basil Soup
instructions: Heat olive oil in a pot over medium heat.
Add onion and garlic, cooking until softened.
Add the canned tomatoes and broth. Bring to a boil.
Reduce heat and simmer for 20 minutes.
Stir in the fresh basil and season with salt and pepper.
Blend the soup until smooth.
Serve hot.

name: Chocolate Chip Cookies
instructions: Preheat the oven to 170°C (350°F).
Sift together the flour and baking soda; set aside.
In a medium bowl, cream together the melted butter, brown sugar, and white sugar.
Beat in the vanilla, egg, and egg yolk until light and creamy.
Mix in the sifted ingredients until just blended.
Stir in the chocolate chips by hand using a wooden spoon.
Drop cookie dough 1/4 cup at a time onto the prepared cookie sheets.
Bake for 15 to 17 minutes, or until the edges are lightly toasted.
Cool on baking sheets for a few minutes before transferring to wire racks to cool completely.

name: Guacamole
instructions: In a medium bowl, mash together the avocados, lime juice, and salt.
Mix in the onion, cilantro, tomatoes, and garlic.
Stir in cayenne pepper if desired.
Refrigerate 1 hour for best flavor, or serve immediately.

name: French Toast
instructions: In a shallow bowl, whisk together the eggs, milk, vanilla, and cinnamon.
Heat a skillet over medium heat and add butter or oil.
Dip each slice of bread in the egg mixture, soaking both sides.
Cook the bread slices in the skillet until golden brown on both sides.
Serve hot with maple syrup and powdered sugar.
